title: ‘Queer’ movie ban in Turkey prompts film festival cancellation
content: The festival’s host said the ban on “Queer,” which stars Daniel Craig, “restricts art and freedom of expression.”
summary: The festival’s host said the ban on “Queer,” which stars Daniel Craig, “restricts art and freedom of expression.”

title: Hurricane Rafael plunges Cuba into another nationwide blackout
content: The storm has damaged the country’s already struggling electrical infrastructure, leading to widespread power outages.
summary: The storm has damaged the country’s already struggling electrical infrastructure, leading to widespread power outages.

title: 50 world leaders meet to strategize on how to deal with Trump
content: In Budapest, leaders spoke about the need for unity and autonomy. But there was also agitation about Trump’s return and Germany’s political paralysis.
summary: In Budapest, leaders spoke about the need for unity and autonomy. But there was also agitation about Trump’s return and Germany’s political paralysis.

title: ‘We have won’: Russians envision new global system with Trump victory
content: Russians see Donald Trump’s win as a victory for conservative, isolationist forces in the world against a liberal, Western-dominated global order.
summary: Russians see Donald Trump’s win as a victory for conservative, isolationist forces in the world against a liberal, Western-dominated global order.

title: ‘This is awkward’: World leaders contend with past insults of Trump
content: After Donald Trump’s 2024 election win, officials in Britain, France and Australia who previously criticized him are deleting tweets and writing congratulatory messages.
summary: After Donald Trump’s 2024 election win, officials in Britain, France and Australia who previously criticized him are deleting tweets and writing congratulatory messages.

title: Viral breakdancer Raygun to stop competing after Olympics backlash
content: Australian B-girl Rachael Gunn said it would be “difficult” to compete now with the “level of scrutiny that’s going to be there,” although she still loved dancing.
summary: Australian B-girl Rachael Gunn said it would be “difficult” to compete now with the “level of scrutiny that’s going to be there,” although she still loved dancing.

title: China, already grappling with a weak economy, braces for Trump’s return
content: Ties between Beijing and Washington worsened sharply during Donald Trump’s first term. But some in China see a potential bridge builder in his second: Elon Musk.
summary: Ties between Beijing and Washington worsened sharply during Donald Trump’s first term. But some in China see a potential bridge builder in his second: Elon Musk.

title: Trump win spurs interest in 4B, fringe South Korean movement to swear off men
content: In light of Donald Trump’s victory, some American women say they are turning to a movement that advocates no sex, dating or marriage with men and no children.
summary: In light of Donald Trump’s victory, some American women say they are turning to a movement that advocates no sex, dating or marriage with men and no children.

title: Ukrainian congratulations do little to mask fears about Trump presidency
content: Trump has expressed misgivings about continuing to support Ukraine in its war with Russia. Ukrainian officials recognize they need to win him over.
summary: Trump has expressed misgivings about continuing to support Ukraine in its war with Russia. Ukrainian officials recognize they need to win him over.

title: Trump win complicates Biden’s lame-duck foreign policy
content: From Ukraine to Gaza, Trump’s unilateral and unpredictable tendencies could embolden both allies and enemies.
summary: From Ukraine to Gaza, Trump’s unilateral and unpredictable tendencies could embolden both allies and enemies.

title: Trump win leaves Russia jubilant and Europe putting on a brave face
content: Israel’s and Ukraine’s leaders were among the first to congratulate Donald Trump. His victory is resonating across the globe.
summary: Israel’s and Ukraine’s leaders were among the first to congratulate Donald Trump. His victory is resonating across the globe.

title: U.S. vote was peaceful, but Trump’s fraud claims hurt trust, international observers say
content: International monitors saw “a well-run process” in Tuesday’s U.S. election, but warned of “intolerant language against women and immigrants by one candidate.”
summary: International monitors saw “a well-run process” in Tuesday’s U.S. election, but warned of “intolerant language against women and immigrants by one candidate.”

title: Trump’s win puts militarized, mass deportations on the agenda
content: The reelection of Donald Trump sets the stage for policy changes that could upend the lives of millions of immigrants and recast the U.S. economy and labor force.
summary: The reelection of Donald Trump sets the stage for policy changes that could upend the lives of millions of immigrants and recast the U.S. economy and labor force.

title: German governing coalition collapses, adding upheaval in uncertain moment
content: Chancellor Olaf Scholz fired his finance minister and announced a confidence vote that is widely expected to fail and pave the way to early elections in the spring.
summary: Chancellor Olaf Scholz fired his finance minister and announced a confidence vote that is widely expected to fail and pave the way to early elections in the spring.

title: In Trump victory, Netanyahu sees himself as ‘the great winner’
content: Across Israel, a country battered by its longest-ever war and roiled by internal crises, many breathed a sigh of relief after Trump’s sweeping triumph.
summary: Across Israel, a country battered by its longest-ever war and roiled by internal crises, many breathed a sigh of relief after Trump’s sweeping triumph.

title: The U.S. has never been led by a woman. See how many countries have been.
content: The U.S. has still not been led by a woman — a state increasingly rare in the world. Enter your birthday to find out the number of women who have served as president or prime minister around the world.
summary: The U.S. has still not been led by a woman — a state increasingly rare in the world. Enter your birthday to find out the number of women who have served as president or prime minister around the world.

title: Right-wing populists cheer the return of Trump, one of their own
content: Populist leaders around the world said Donald Trump’s election victory was an endorsement of their stance on immigration, on climate and in the culture wars.
summary: Populist leaders around the world said Donald Trump’s election victory was an endorsement of their stance on immigration, on climate and in the culture wars.

title: Israel Katz, new Israeli defense minister, is longtime Netanyahu ally
content: Analysts describe Katz as a yes-man who will give Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu more freedom on the battlefield and help ensure his own political survival.
summary: Analysts describe Katz as a yes-man who will give Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu more freedom on the battlefield and help ensure his own political survival.

title: Ukraine says forces clash with North Korean troops for first time
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky implored his Western allies to take action over Russia’s use of North Korean troops in the war.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky implored his Western allies to take action over Russia’s use of North Korean troops in the war.

title: What Trump’s win means for the world’s most pressing problems
content: Republican Donald Trump will face immediate challenges as the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars rage. What his election means for NATO, aid, trade and more.
summary: Republican Donald Trump will face immediate challenges as the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars rage. What his election means for NATO, aid, trade and more.

title: Lebanese first responders say they are being targeted by Israeli strikes
content: At least 178 Lebanese emergency workers have been killed in Israeli attacks since last October. Three-quarters of the deaths have occurred in the past six weeks.
summary: At least 178 Lebanese emergency workers have been killed in Israeli attacks since last October. Three-quarters of the deaths have occurred in the past six weeks.

title: What this U.S. election showed the world about America
content: Harris and her allies cast Trump as unprecedented, fascistic threat. Trump, meanwhile, stewed in the same angry ultranationalism that powered his earlier presidential bids.
summary: Harris and her allies cast Trump as unprecedented, fascistic threat. Trump, meanwhile, stewed in the same angry ultranationalism that powered his earlier presidential bids.

title: Netanyahu fires Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, prompting protest in Tel Aviv
content: Yoav Gallant had emerged as one of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s fiercest and most public critics over his approach to the war in Gaza and the failure to reach a hostage deal with Hamas.
summary: Yoav Gallant had emerged as one of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s fiercest and most public critics over his approach to the war in Gaza and the failure to reach a hostage deal with Hamas.
